Title: Cleaning up our oceans with smart robots
Teaser: EU-backed researchers are deploying a fleet of autonomous robots to tackle litter on the ocean surface and floor.

Title: What’s culture got to do with energy consumption?
Teaser: An EU initiative has launched an online interactive data set of sustainable energy initiatives across Europe. The database could help policymakers reduce greenhouse gas emissions and decarbonise the economy.

Teaser: The adoption of precision farming techniques is allowing the EU to increase its agricultural output whilst ensuring the sustainability of the European agri-food sector. Consequently, the EU has been supporting cutting-edge research and innovation into a number of exciting solutions that will truly harness all of the opportunities from what promises to be a truly 21st century agricultural revolution.

Title: Faster drug discovery to fight the Zika virus
Teaser: Using high-performance computing, researchers have demonstrated a breakthrough approach that scales up and accelerates the discovery of novel drugs.

Title: Dos and don’ts of data-driven policymaking
Teaser: Public administrations and the private sector are not equally equipped to adopt new technologies. The Big Policy Canvas project has identified possible pathways to even out the odds.

Title: Private finance for energy efficiency: New solutions for funding Europe’s energy transition
Teaser: Making European societies and economies more energy-efficient will play a key role in allowing the EU to meet its climate ambitions, create growth and improve well-being, particularly to meet the goal of making the EU carbon-neutral by 2050. Whilst energy efficiency has not always been considered as an attractive investment by the financial sector in the past, this updated Pack features 13 EU-funded projects that have set a new dynamic for accelerating and upscaling private financing of energy efficiency investments across the EU, as well as making such investments much more attractive to investors.

Title: EU regions pilot a circular economy approach to bulky waste management
Teaser: The URBANREC project is working to improve opportunities for recovering waste stream materials through enhanced management of bulky waste.

Title: Cities come together to tackle mountains of waste
Teaser: Seven cities from the European Union united to test the best ways to reduce and recycle waste. The work on the Urban_Wins project offers solutions to an emergency situation before it’s too late.

Title: Fostering a dialogue on synthetic biology
Teaser: New areas of science, such as synthetic biology often cause public concern and require responsible governance. SYNENERGENE has engaged citizens across Europe in thinking about the challenges and opportunities synthetic biology poses.

Title: Novel modular mining equipment supports sustainable and cost-effective mining in Europe
Teaser: Earth is not running out of metallic and semi-metallic resources, but the largest, highest-grade, and shallowest deposits have been depleted. Enhancing the economic feasibility and adoption of lower-impact small-scale mining operations will address market needs and environmental protection while boosting competitiveness.

Title: Publicly accessible research on the water sector
Teaser: An EU-funded project is directing the flow of water research to broader society in order to promote an environmentally conscious and informed citizenry.

Title: Reinventing the role of water and waste in mining
Teaser: Mining operations use large amounts of water and land and produce tailings waste, taking a major toll on the environment. Researchers have developed technologies to help mining companies reduce their water consumption and extract value from their tailings waste.

Title: Tackling litter in European seas
Teaser: Marine litter (ML) is accumulating in European seas because of unsustainable consumption and production models, inadequate waste management and lack of public awareness. An EU initiative addressed these challenges, helping to involve, educate and empower citizens.
